channel.title: [317] [PI] Most customs not equiping
channel.description: Title explains it all basically.. Only like 5 customs out of 15 will equip. Lime whip and Lava whip equips but pink, white, iron etc.. doesn't I've checked item.java and everything is in there. Any help? (No spoonfeeding please, just hints and tips)

item.title: [317] [PI] Most customs not equiping
item.dc:creator: @WretchBack WretchBack
item.description:
@WretchBack wrote:

Ok this is one of the customs that doesnt work -

case 16021: itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.newModelColor = new int[1]; itemDef.editedModelColor = new int[1]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 55101; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 55100; itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 55100; itemDef.modelZoom = 840; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 280; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 0; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -2; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 56; itemDef.anInt204 = 0; itemDef.name = "Iron Whip"; itemDef.description = "Whip for the most experienced pkers."; itemDef.newModelColor[0] = 17350; itemDef.editedModelColor[0] = 528; break;

thats my itemdef.java code.

this is my item.cfg -

and this is my itemassistant.java

public static String[] WEAPONS = {"greegree", "stafd", "flower", "flail", "sceptre", "hand", "mace", "dart", "knife", "javelin", "scythe", "claws", "bow", "crossbow", "c' bow", "adze", "axe", "sword", "rapier", "scimitar", "spear", "dagger", "staff", "wand", "blade", "whip", "silverlight", "darklight", "maul", "halberd", "anchor", "tzhaar-ket-om", "hammer", "hand cannon"};

and

} else if (WeaponName.endsWith("whip")) { c.setSidebarInterface(0, 12290); //flick, lash, deflect c.getPA().sendFrame246(12291, 200, Weapon); c.getPA().sendFrame126(WeaponName, 12293);

and

for (int i = 0; i < WEAPONS.length; i++) { if (item.contains(WEAPONS[i])) targetSlot = 3; }

i cant figure this out more hints/tips?

Read full topic

item.title: [317] [PI] Most customs not equiping
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

It’s not client sided. Check ItemAssistant.java and item.cfg. You should have an array of items and what slot they should go in if you haven’t changed it. Make sure the items are also added into item.cfg. The codes in ItemAssistant.java get the data from item.cfg. For example:

I recently added a new item slot for auras. This is the item stats/name in item.cfg.

And this is my code in ItemAssistant.java:

Notice that i have “corruption” in the array. What this does is that it gets all the items that have corruption in them in item.cfg.

Now, there should also be something similar to this in the same file but with something like “ARROWS” or “SHIELDS”:

for (int i = 0; i < AURA.length; i++) { if (item.contains(AURA[i])) targetSlot = 14; }
What this does is that it gets the data from the array called “AURA” and it sets the slot to 14.

Hope this helps you.

Read full topic
